Apr 8

And the Winner Is…

A calendar-themed short story

“This brings us to the final award of the evening. Let me pause for a quick word about our two title sponsors. Jonas and Sons Pamphlet and Pamphleteering — look no further than Jonas and Sons for all of your pamphlet related business, especially because they are the only pamphlet related business. And the Turkey Company — they trade much more than just turkeys, they trade with turkeys, I mean Turkey. Sorry, everyone, just a little trade humor.

“And now, the moment you’ve all been waiting on pins and needles for — sorry we should have swept up beforehand. Ladies and gentlemen, your 1582 recipient of the invention of the year, Pope Gregory XIII with his revised Julian calendar! Pope, come on down!”

“Thank you, thank you very much. You are too kind. Really. Please, enough clapping. Oh okay, keep it coming. I love you all so much.

“I’m king of the world! Actually, the Pope, but I feel like a king right now and will be partying it up like a king later let me tell you. A celibate, sober king, but a king just the same. Celibate, sober parties are the best — said no one ever.

“Before I begin, I want to address the elephant in the room, and no, I don’t mean the elephant over there in the corner that I intend on riding home just for shits and giggles, because, hey, I am the Pope. No, I want to talk about the rumours that, years ago, I fathered an illegitimate son. Well, let me tell you, I did father a son and, not that I’m bragging, but he is one fine specimen of a man and, ladies, he’s single!

“You know, this is just amazing, so amazing, standing up here right now. I just can’t believe I won. I mean I knew there was a chance — I am the Pope and people are overly referential and sort of freaked out around me and giving me free stuff all the time anyways. The free stuff is constant — not that I’m complaining. And I didn’t want to count my chickens. No, I have servants to do that for me. Seriously. Tons of chicken-counting servants.

“As the winner of this quite illustrious and sought-after prize, I think back on all of the tough times when I lay in bed having to refuse more peeled grapes and prosciutto. I love cured pork like the rest of you, but at some point a man’s got to get some work done! Am I right or am I right? But there were many moments when I just wanted to pack it up and quit. I’d say to myself ‘Pope,’ — I always call myself Pope, especially when trying to psyche myself up in front of the mirror— ‘Pope, you got this. Give the people the gift of a fully functional calendar. Plus, selling these new calendars full of pictures of your to-die-for illegitimate son would be an excellent way to fundraise.

“Now you may be wondering, why the calendar? Well, I had a vision. Yes, I had a vision my friends and in this vision an old woman wearing the most spectacular silk, came to me and told me that I must drop everything and learn to belly dance. Oops, wrong vision. You’ll have to excuse me, but I have lots of visions, all the time. I am the Pope, after all. Anyways, I had this vision where I was walking and came across this old woman, who was surrounded by sheep, and she told me I had to fix Easter. Turns out it wasn’t a vision — just my aunt Gwendolyn, who has taken up shearing in her free time.

“But then I thought, ‘Come on, Pope. You can do this! No one will really miss those 10 days between October 4th and the 14th except for your neighbours, and those two complain and call the authorities about everything. They are so dumb, don’t they know that I am the authority?’

“I would be remiss if I didn’t thank my two friends, Aloysius and Christopher, without whom I wouldn’t be here today. I’m kidding! Those slackers did nothing except riding my coat tails, which essentially was just me standing there as they sat on my coat tails, motionless, shouting ‘giddy-up’. But seriously, you will hear rumors that those two ‘astronomers’ did the real work, while I just stood around looking pretty and then stamped my name on it. Totally, completely, mostly untrue.

“I must also thank my predecessor, Julius Caesar. Without his clunky calendar and his sheer stupidity I wouldn’t be holding this trophy. I mean how hard is it to add and divide? I’m kidding, I’m kidding, I love that guy! And that salad dressing he spent much of his free time devising is soooo good. I put that stuff on everything, which is obvious when you see my love handles. Clearly ahead of his time, except for when it came to making calendars.

“Now, I don’t want to toot my own horn — again, the papacy comes with tons of horn tooters, a legion of them in fact, literally — but early reviews of my calendar are in and the critics are calling it “the best calendar since sliced bread which isn’t saying a whole lot as no one uses sliced bread as a calendar” and “totally a page turner” and “now the people finally have something to give their great aunt for her birthday”.

“Let me take a second to address the common folk out there. I know you are bitter about this switch from one calendar to another and I’ve heard that many of you think I am somehow trying to cheat you by making you pay rent for a whole month only to eliminate the days and not issue refunds. I repeat — no refunds. But, before you get angry with me, remember that I am doing the work of God. I am only doing what he has requested in our weekly private conversation each Sunday morning at 6:45am. Would it hurt Him to let me sleep in? Not that I’m complaining.

“When I first set off to revise the calendar, my advisers scoffed at me. Can you believe that? Scoffing at The Pope! Where do they get off? Well, suffice it to say, but they are now counting my chickens, literally. And then with my new team, I worked them hard. Those nerdy math guys in the backroom kept kneeling at my feet, kissing my toes, and weeping that the best they could do was a 0.001% correction in the length of the year from the previous calendar and I put my foot down and said no! I won’t stand for anything less than 0.0002% and I refused to give in to their whining and requests for more cheese. Those guys eat a lot of cheese, by the way.

“My buddies, Aloysius and Christopher, who put the final touches on this, sort of like a really sugary icing on what was already a spectacular cake and almost ruining it — you all know what I’m talking about — anyways, they were going on and on and on about the drifting of the equinoxes and the solstices and the setting of the date of Easter it was getting annoying, let me tell you! They wouldn’t shut up! I had to get all Popey and stuff as they were forgetting who they were talking to. Making me feel sort of like an idiot and no one, and I repeat, no one makes me feel like an idiot!

“Sorry for that, but I’m just so excited about this award and the fact that the lunar cycle has finally been corrected as that was such a constant annoyance. True story — as a young boy, I used to lie in the fields of my parents’ estate looking up at the moon, just wishing it could be my friend while my parents stood inside watching me and slowly shaking their heads in disbelief. I was a lonely kid.

“Now, this whole calendar thing started when Aloysius came to me, panting and out of breath — that dude needs to cut way back on the stromboli — suggesting we reduce the number of leap years in four centuries from 100 to 97, by making 3 out of 4 centurial years common instead of leap years. I stopped him and suggested he get out more. Maybe socialize with other humans once and awhile.

“I want to let all of you in on a big reveal that should be trending any day now, but in addition to the change in the mean length of the calendar year from 365.25 days to 365.2425 days, I’ve found a way to reduce the year by 10 minutes 48 seconds per year. My next goal, increasing the length and width of my hat. This hat is hilarious and plays big downtown.

“Anyways, it looks like my time is up as this yahoo off stage is giving me the neck being hooked by the end of a cane motion repeatedly. Can you believe this guy? I’m the Pope and the last time someone hooked my neck with a cane I hadn’t taken my vow of celibacy yet, if you know what I’m sayin’. Anyways, I gotta run, you’ve been great. I think with my next act, I’m going to exhaust the papal treasury. Or as the voice inside my head is always saying ‘Spend, spend, spend, baby.’

“Peace out!”

Thanks to Aura Wilming.
